page.title: 04Housing
page.content: The most famous house in Withern was the best preserved mud and stud cottage in the country which has now been removed, in its original state and put in the Church Farm Museum in Skegness. Some of the original rectories, farmhouses and cottages in the area have been privately restored but for the most part, housing comprises of modern urban development. However, there are no housing estates, most dwellings being scattered along the Mablethorpe road which runs through the village. The council has erected several houses for local workers and a number of old people's bungalows.
